title: Great location, lovely hotel
text:
Stayed here for a long weekend and was very impressed. It's in fantastic location with amazing views from some rooms. However if you really want views go up to the roof top bar / restaurant - it's amazing!

Breakfast has plenty of choice and very tasty.

Food & drinks are reasonably priced and there's a good selection.

Rooms are spacious with balconies but lacking a dressing table.

Overall, would definitely recommend.

title: Spectacular
text: The photos don't do it justice - make sure you visit in person. It's spectacular and walking up to the top gives you a real sense of perspective on the size of the place. Definitely worth the cheap entry fee to actually go in and walk round.

title: Beautiful area - absolute must!
text:
It's like a little Greek village in the middle of Athens - white washed houses, winding cobbled streets, little squares with tavernas - loved it!

Don't miss visiting Plaka Stairs!

title: Absolute must
text:
Amazing views, feels like you're stepping into history. It's a must see if you're in Athens.

It can get busy so go in the morning if possible.

title: Interesting Museum
text:
Once you've visited the acropolis go to the museum to see all the antiquities and you can put it all into context.

Good value, cafe is ok if a little over-priced.

title: Pleasant staff, good beer
text:
Good place to watch football. Be aware that it's quite small although there is seating and TVs outside, so be prepared to get there early if you want a seat.

Good choice of drinks at reasonable prices.

title: Good food, good beer
text:
If you're looking for classic Italian good, look no further.

Food is good quality, cooked well, tasty & good size portions.

Advise to book as it gets very busy.

title: Great location, spacious rooms, excellent breakfast
text:
Rooms are spacious with everything you need. Mini bar prices are reasonable and all toiletries are provided in a good standard bathroom.

Location is brilliant, if your looking for a city centre hotel - this is the one.

Lacking a decent bar and there no actual restaurant for food outside of breakfast although there is room service available for snacks.

Breakfast is buffet style with good choices.

title: Brilliant zoo - so much to see!
text:
We arrived around 11 and the car park was filling up, however we still managed to get a space only a few minutes walk from the entrance.

The zoo is massive, we were there until closing time and still didn't manage to see all the animals. It's well laid out and easy to make your way round.

Suggest taking a picnic as the food is ok but over -priced.

Don't spend extra on the train it's not really worth it and you can walk just as easily.

Also, the free boat ride it good for giving little tired legs a rest but it's a bit boring.

We all had a brilliant time and I would happily go again.

title: Nice hotel, out dated decor & dodgy house keeping
text:
I stayed 4 nights here and I would say that the room was comfortable and spacious with a large bathroom, however the decor of the hotel is very out dated and in places peeling off the wall.

The room wasn't cleaned to a standard of what I would expect and the hallway was clutters with pieces of furniture and a dirty rag that sat on the carpet for the duration of my visit.

The bar is non-existent and never open. The restaurant was of decent quality and the waiter very attentive.

Plenty of TV channels in all languages and a good mini bar in the room.

Overall a decent hotel but definitely not a 4*.

title: Great place for cocktails
text: This is a great hidden gem of a bar serving interesting and tasty cocktails. They have an extensive menu but are also open to make a special cocktail for you if you ask.

title: Nice restaurant with good choices
text:
Visited with friends on a weekday evening and although it fairly busy, found the service to be attentive and the food to be good.

They have an English menu and the beer on tap is recommended.

title: Definitely worth the time to visit
text: It's not just another castle! Lots to see inside, with some really interesting exhibits. Be prepared to walk a lot, queues are likely when it's busy and not a lot to eat / drink within the grounds, but overall definitely worth the visit!

title: Lovely hotel, brilliant breakfast but some building work going on
text:
We stayed 3 nights here and loved the hotel, however there is some building work going on so expect some noise during the day.

The breakfast is extensive and tasty, it can be busy at peak times so choose when you go.

Bar is small but with good service.

Location is perfect, easy walk to all the attractions

title: Another fantastic meal!
text:
We had a lovely family dinner here at the weekend and it was amazing as always!

The service is brilliant, very helpful and polite. Food was up to the usual high standard - I would recommend trying the Christmas pizza if you fancy something different.

Love coming here and to its sister restaurant The Swan at Walton. Loyalty points are a bonus!

title: Amazing burgers, funky decor & good music!
text:
Be warned this place is cosy and there aren't a lot of tables so you may have to wait on a table if you haven't booked in advance.

The burgers are amazing, cooked to perfection and so tasty! Also, very reasonably priced.

Make sure you visit here!

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
I returned here for a night recently and it did not disappoint. Comfortable bed, all amenities in the room and welcoming staff.

Breakfast if buffet style & good quality. Bar is reasonably priced and comfortable.

If you need a reasonably priced hotel in Birmingham this one is a must!
place: Hampton by Hilton Birmingham Broad Street

title: Great for all the family
text:
We visited the Victorian town first to get our passport and spent a very enjoyable 4 hours exploring.

Kids of all ages enjoyed it, with lots to see and do. On site restaurant is good value with quality food.

The old sweet shop went down very well with the kids!

Lots of walking but the kids didn't notice as there are always things to draw their attention.

title: Birthday party executed to perfection
text:
I held my birthday party here and the service from the day I requested a quote through to the evening itself was amazing.

The quality of the buffet was mentioned by all guests and the room set up was very pretty.

Emma is an amazing singer and kept guests of all ages entertained.

If you're looking for a decent sized venue, with amazing food and its own bar - don't look anywhere else!

title: Comfortable hotel, good location for Stratford & Olympic Park & great value
text: I booked a room here for a fantastic rate (for London) and was not disappointed. It's located in Westfield, Stratford right next to the Olympic park. Check in is easy due to the self service screens, beds are very comfortable and room is standard size. Bar area was comfortable and reasonably priced. My only bug bear with all Premier Inns is the quality of the toilet paper - please fix this Premier Inn!

title: Food awesome, terrible service!
text: We went in on a Thursday evening and we had to wait on a table as it was pretty busy. Luckily our wait was only 5 mins and we got seated at our table. There was a server in our area but they weren't looking after our table, so we waited for some time before a waiter came up to take our order. The food came in a reasonable time, however we had no cutlery or napkins and again with no waiter to be seen to ask for them. We flagged down another waiter and eventually got some cutlery. There is a fixed menu Mon - Fri which is good value and I would recommend it. The quality of the food was spot on, however we had to wait again when he main course came to get more cutlery and order more drinks. Again, we had to wait to get our bill and pay. I understand that they were busy, but it did look like other areas of the restaurant were getting much better service than us.

title: Great value & good food
text:
We had a lovely dinner here on a Friday night, they had tables available for walk-ins and although we were seated near the door, we didn't feel the cold as the servers are brilliant at ensuring the door was always closed over.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and really enjoyed the meal.

Would definitely recommend a visit!

title: Great location, spacious rooms, could do with a bit of modernisation
text: We had a lovely weekend in Durham as the Royal County Hotel, it has ample parking, excellent location to explore Durham and a comfortable stay. Beds are a little too hard for my taste but the rooms are spacious and don't lack for amenities. The bar is comfortable and reasonably priced. The rooms are a little tired in places, however overall it's a good hotel for the price.

title: Busy!
text: We were lucky to get a table on a busy Friday night, however the quality was not compromised and the server was attentive.

title: Amazing food, beware the size of the desserts!
text: We had a lovely birthday meal - the waiting staff are attentive and the food of a high quality. Pizzas are made fresh to order, this did mean that half our table had their pizzas whilst the rest were waiting on their meals from the main menu, however we were warned this might happen. The desserts are HUGE, so much so that we asked to take ours away in a pizza box to eat the next day! Make sure you book as even on a week night it can be hard to get a table.

title: Lovely hotel, great rooms, fantastic staff, awesome food!
text:
We arrived after already checking in on the App, which meant we could go straight to our room and use the phone as our key (love it!), however we realised that we had been allocated a room right next to the stairs, so we asked at reception if we could move to another room and they were more than accommodating, even offering a room upgrade!

The Club rooms are lovely with more space Sky Movies and a coffee maker. Since the weather was bad, we spent all day Saturday watching movies which was great.

The gym and pool are in excellent condition and free to use as a guest, there are times when the pool is busy with swimming lessons, but this is to be expected.

The staff at the bar and restaurant were polite, welcoming and helpful.

We eat in the restaurant on the first night and in the bar on the second night and we could not fault the food, my only criticism is that they've removed hash browns from breakfast.

Definitely worth a visit to this hotel, this is the 3rd time we've visited and we will be back.

title: Great for the younger kids, not so much for teenagers
text:
We visited one Saturday as a family and really enjoyed it.

We set off early, but I would say not early enough as the closer we got to Legoland the worse the traffic got, so although the park opens at 10, aim to be there earlier, we probably eventually got in about 10.45.

The park is really well laid out and there are queues the same as in any theme park, however note the rides are really aimed at primary school aged children, our teenager was bored for most of the day.

I was surprised by the cost of some of the food, it was actually reasonably priced(!) which is very unusual for a theme park.

Overall, a good day out and be prepared to queue lots.

title: Spacious rooms, lovely staff, good location
text:
We booked through the website where you receive 20% off any food in the restaurant, which was a good bonus!

This is a new hotel, rooms are comfortable, spacious, free WiFi and air con (unusual for this type of hotel).

If you need a decent hotel in Livingston, I would definitely recommend this place.

title: Good food reasonably priced, staff are lovely!
text: We were staying at the hotel next door and eat here a couple of times, I could not fault the quality of food - pretty standard pub grub, however the staff are what makes it, they are friendly, smiling and chatty - a real credit to the place!

title: Awesome food, but can be really busy at times
text: We visited one Saturday lunchtime, the food was amazing and service good, however we had to wait on a table and were seated downstairs. It is worth the wait though, the best Italian food I've had for a long time!

title: Lovely hotel, great staff, amazing food - cannot fault it!
text:
We travelled as a family for 1 week holiday and could not have been more pleased with the hotel. There is a fantastic range of food, with something for everyone - children and adults alike.

The animation team are great, especially those who work at the kids club - our kids were excited to attend every day and to go to the mini disco in the evening.

The rooms are clean and have everything you need including tea & coffee making facilities and a fridge.

The hotel is ideally placed only 20 mins from the Airport, right on the beach and around 1km from Caleta de Fuste.
place: Elba Carlota Beach And Convention Resort

title: Awesome food - be warned big portions!
text:
Had dinner here on a Monday evening and it was busier than expected however this took nothing away from the service or the quality of food. The main course was brilliant however it was just too big a portion and I couldn't finish it.

Lovely setting and the staff were attentive & friendly.

title: Beautiful square, lots to see & a vibrant place to visit
text: We travelled here in March and found that the square comes alive at the weekend. We first visited on Friday evening and found it to be quiet, however went back on Saturday and it was much more alive, with lots of people and things going on.

title: Gorgeous!
text: What a gorgeous space, interesting buildings, full of character and lots to see on every street. It's worth walking around up and down the little alley ways as there is something to see on every corner, don't just stick the the main square.

title: Amazing steaks, great service & reasonably priced - make sure you book table in advance!
text:
We made a reservation online as we had realised that it might be quite busy on a Saturday night and we we'reright to do so. In the time we were there at least 3 or 4 groups were turned away because they didn't have a reservation.

The steaks are amazing! Cooked to perfection, a quality cut of meat and very reasonably priced. The service was brilliant and the wine also reasonable priced.

Do not miss this place if you're travelling to Warsaw!

title: Great hotel, huge rooms, lovely staff & good bar
text:
The rooms are massive, with a comfortable bed that is also huge. Facilities in the room are brilliant with a huge walk in shower.

The staff can't do enough for you and I would recommend lunch in the hotel bar, it exceeded our expectations.

title: Good selection of beers
text: Good selection of beers and a good place to watch the football. Service struggled at times and it was busy at the bar, however it's a nice place for a few drinks.

title: Great burgers!
text: We happened across this place for lunch and were pleasantly surprised. The service was brilliant and the burgers were awesome, all at a good price.

title: Nice hotel, close to town, smallish rooms
text:
Nice hotel, with good staff. Make sure you note the WiFi details before you head to your room, as there are details in the room to help you connect.

Hotel is clean, great facilities in the rooms (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, moisturiser, ironing board, hairdryer) although my room was on the small side, it was fine for 1 night.
place: Hampton by Hilton Bristol City Centre

title: Awesome range of burgers
text:
Staff are great, food is awesome!

You can build your own burger, with a wide-range of types of burger (kangaroo among them alongside your classic beef burger), buns and toppings all at a very reasonable price - could not fault it!

title: Great lunch made to order & good value!
text:
Went for lunch here last week and was pleasantly surprised! Food was great, quick service and pretty good value for the portion size.

Definitely worth going.

title: Great meal, lovely surroundings & great value for money
text:
We visited for dinner and were blown away with the food & service. The staff can't do enough for you, they are attentive without being overly fussy and so friendly.

The food was amazing! We ordered 3 mini kebabs between us for starters and they were very tasty & just enough for a starter. We then both had pizzas and be warned they are huge, but amazing and could not fault it.

Looking forward to coming back and taking advantage of the 100 beers & extensive wine list!

title: Amazing range of food, all fresh - leave room for dessert!
text:
We popped in following a shopping trip and were pleasantly surprised. The range of food is much better than any other buffet restaurant and I found it all to be of good quality & fresh.

The only problem is that the food is so amazing, it's difficult to leave room for dessert and you really have to - the sheer variety is unbelievable & again the quality & freshness cannot be faulted.

title: Great fun for all the family
text:
We had a lovely day here, the kids loved it and the adults had a good time too! There's enough rides for all ages & abilities, the queues to get on the rides were small and the food in the cafe is surprisingly good (& reasonably priced!) for a place like this.

Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good day out with the family.

title: Asked to leave because out party weren't spending enough
text:
For the last couple of months we have been going to Via Fossa for a team meeting on a Friday afternoon, normally in there for about an hour, with around 8/10 of us & normally most of the group buys a drink, whether it is a pint of cola or beer.

However, on Friday the manager (I guess, although they didn't tell us exactly who they were) asked to speak to one of our group and asked us not to come back as we aren't spending enough money! Her argument is that we are taking up space that other customers could have & spend more money, like buying food.

I'm sure this is the case, however considering the place is normally dead (one of the reasons we go there, as there is normally loads of spare tables!), I would have thought that any money in the till would be better than no money - obviously not! Very rude and if that's their version of customer service, I'm appalled.

title: Lovely quick lunch
text:
Met friends here for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised! Have been in a few times before for drinks, however this was the first time I've eaten here and I'll definitely be back.

I had the nachos with pulled pork and it was amazing! Enough salsa, guacamole & sour cream for a decent portion of nachos and the pulled pork was tender & tasty.

title: Food cold & orders incorrect
text:
We booked a table for a group and asked if we should give a per-order (knowing we had limited time for lunch), but were advised that it would be fine. We all gave in orders & then had to wait 50 mins for the food to arrive, which was luke warm at best and in some cases cold. 2 of our parties order were incorrect, and it took so long for the replacement burger to arrive, the rest of the party had to leave.

Very disappointed! The offer of compensation for the late burger was a free drink.

title: Lovely food, great staff & beautiful setting
text:
We had lunch here as a family and it was great. It is slightly more expensive than a pub lunch, but the quality was very good and the portions were substantial.

Welcoming for kids, with colouring in available.

title: Good quality food, nice atmosphere
text: Lovely restaurant, very welcoming and the food was good quality. One of the nicest meals I've had, with some lovely touches. Value is OK, with standard restaurant prices, but portion sizes were good and everyone has clean plates at the end!

title: Amazing views, food good, service OK
text: We booked for dinner and could not fault the food, was cooked well & everyone enjoyed their meal. We were disappointed by the service, we weren't shown to our table, they took time to take our drink order, we had to ask about specials and had to catch the staff a number of times to ask for additional drinks throughout the meal. It let down what was a otherwise great experience.

title: Great bar food
text: We had a nice family meal here whilst on holiday in the area, the staff were attentive and the food good, exactly what you'd expect from a family run pub.

title: Amazing food, quite expensive for lunch
text: We stopped off here for a late lunch and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, however it was quite expensive for what was ultimately a bar meal.

title: Big portions!
text:
What a lovely lunch we had here on Sunday, the staff are pleasant & welcoming, the pub is in a great setting, however be warned the portions are HUGE!

The kids meals were as big as an adults, the adults meals couldn't be finished.

Good value & would definitely recommend.

title: Friendly, helpful staff, great location & great value
text: I spent 1 night here over a weekend and found it to be a nice hotel. The staff were great, we arrived early on the 1st day (4 hrs before checkin) and they happily checked us in and we got access to our room. Room was usual Premier Inn level and it was a bit of noise from the corridor. Bar was good, with a decent range of drinks and reasonably priced.
place: Premier Inn Belfast Titanic Quarter Hotel

title: Really interesting and interactive - would definitely recommend!
text: Found the whole exhibition really interesting. It is great that it is more about the history of Belfast than just the Titanic. Book tickets online and get a discount. Try to arrive before 12pm if you're going at the weekend as it tends to get busy in the afternoon and it means it can be harder to see the displays.

title: One of the best bus tours that i've been on
text: Has a varied route with great guides who know their stuff. Bus was too hot so made the ride a little bit uncomfortable at times. If you're going to Belfast I would 100% recommend you do this as you won't see the true history without it.

title: Lovely Italian with limited menu
text: We luckily got a table here and weren't disappointed. Only had a main course each, but was very well cooked and enjoyable. Very busy as its only small, so book a table if you can!

title: Lovely hotel, amazing meals & great staff
text:
We stayed here at the weekend and although our room was a bit tired and in need of tlc, the staff couldn't do enough for us and were accommodating when I complained.

Meals are fantastic! Reasonably priced and the set-menu is great value for money.

The bar is something else! So much choice of beers! Would highly recommend "The Salty Dog" on tap.
place: The Salty Dog Hotel and Bistro

title: Amazing venue, rooms need a little bit of tlc
text:
I attended a conference here and was amazed by the decor in the main building, it is truly spectacular. Food was brilliant and the staff couldn't do enough for you. Rooms were really spacious, however in some places looked a little bit tired. The shower in the bathroom was actually too powerful, so it wa slike standing in a puddle as the plug couldn't keep up with the quantity of water.

Spa facilities are lovely and the spa staff are brilliant.

title: Great service, lovely food - couldn't do enough for you!
text:
We visited on Saturday night for family dinner and I was impressed.

Service was great, even down to helping sort taxis for us all getting home!

Homemade food was lovely and reasonably priced - I think we all had food envy of each others choices!!

Looking forward to going back again soon.

title: Great value & really tasty!!
text:
Popped in on a Sunday when they have offer of 11.95 for 4 courses and could not fault it.

Food was cooked to perfection, service was attentive, setting is lovely - will definitely be back!!

title: Lovely hotel in need of some TLC
text:
My husband booked this hotel for my birthday, it's easy to find in a good location and with lovely staff.

Easy to get into centre of Cardiff by walking to maintain road to catch bus or as we did walk 5 mins to train station.

Room was very spacious, I think we had a family room, but was really in need of an update, shower leaked all over the bathroom, no air con & cleaning could've been more thorough.

Staff were brilliant though, reception more than helpful and waiting staff attentive.

Overall facilities at this hotel are great, however compared with other Village hotels I've been to, it seems quite tired & in need of an update.

title: Another lovely stay with the best staff
text:
We stayed here as a family of 3 and as usual was impressed by the friendly & helpful staff. We unfortunately had a bereavement in the family and had to extend our stay and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Only issue we had was that there were 3 of us in the room however we were only given 2 towels, reception quickly rectified it though.

First time eating breakfast in the hotel as we normally go to the Toby carvery next door my husband's breakfast was fine however mine was slightly over cooked.

Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely people, great location, needs a it of love & care
text:
Just back from a weeks holiday at this hotel and had a fantastic time. Everything clean, pools lovely, food fantastic and people so friendly & helpful.

We had a family rooms which was really spacious, however was in need of an upgrade to get to true 4* standard.

Entertainment team were fantastic, as were the chefs & waiters. My only criticism is that they could give you more information when you check-in, we spent most of the 1st morning finding out how to get towels, when the kids club opened, etc.

Definitely recommend this hotel, a wee bit (1km) away from the centre of Port el Kantaoui, however £1 / £2 in a taxi was well spent to see the lovely port and shopping district.

title: Nice hotel close to city centre
text: Rooms are spacious, bed was a bit hard for our taste though. Reception was being rennovated when we were there which unfortunately meant long queues to check out. Saying that the staff are polite & can't do enough for you.

title: Lovely hotel, definitely recommend
text:
What an amazing hotel!! Such an unassuming decor outside however inside so beautiful. The rooms have lovely high ceilings, comfy beds & powerful shower.

Location is just outside of city centre so be prepared to walk or get a taxi getting around. However, restaurant across the road is nice as is sports bar if you're looking for cheap beer.

Breakfast is hot & extensive, exactly what I wasn't expecting!!

Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Decent but Too Hot!!!
text:
Nice little hotel next to the train station in Rugby and only about 10 mins walk from town.

Room is OK, bathroom is too small and the shower curtain is rubbish, as all it takes is for you to turn around and the curtain moves then water goes all over the floor. Also, no lock on the bathroom door. Only provided with 1 hand towel and no towel for the floor which isn't great.

Bed is really comfortable.

My biggest issue is that there is no air con in the rooms and it's absolutely boiling in the rooms!! We got a fan from reception, left the window open and still couldn't sleep. I don't understand why Travelodge didn't put air con in the rooms, its a brand new hotel?!?!?

Staff were really helpful and more than happy to provide us with information on how to get into town, where to eat, etc.

title: Lovely meal
text:
We had a meal here, it was a Friday night and wasn't expecting there to be any tables, but they were happy to fit us in. The staff are great and really friendly.

My husband had salmon and I had chicken, we shared the cheese board and I couldn't recommend the quality of food enough.

Definitely worth a try if you are in Rugby!

title: Absolutely Amazing!!
text:
If you like steak - you have to go here - its amazing!! Great simple menu, awesome food and you cook your steak exactly to your liking at your table (simple idea but excellently executed!).

I would travel miles to come and eat here again.

title: Great Lunch
text:
Lovely setting, attentive staff and great food - what more could you ask for!

The sharing platter to start is especially recommended. In a place where there are so many restaurants to choose from, Wildwood is a great choice.

title: Its nice enough, but don't expect anything exceptional ...
text:
We stayed here last night and weren't wowed - it's a nice enough hotel - well to be exact our room was great as we had a studio room - it was spacious and with a fantastic shower. My parents room however was just a standard double and wasn't very big and didn't have the Japanese shower.

My suggestion would be not to eat or drink in the hotel and just walk 5 mins into Wetherby, where the drinks and food are of the same (if not better) quality but cheaper by far! A round of drinks in the hotel cost £12, in town the same round was £9.30.

Tables were left with uncollected glasses for hours on end and my father had to complain about the corridor being left dirty for 2 days, so service wasn't exceptional.

The corridors are a bit dowdy and for an experience you have to try the lift! In all my life I have never seen anything like it!

Its a great location and could be a brilliant hotel, but it was a let down after the other Mercure's that we've stayed in.

title: Outdated hotel, nice rooms, breakfast OK
text:
I stayed here for 2 weeks in Sep 2013 on a business trip and found the hotel OK as Russian standards go, but really outdated on the decor. The rooms are pretty spacious, with full fridge and interesting mini bar, only Russian TV channels available though however there is free wi-fi available throughout the hotel which is fantastic (some western hotels should take note!). Room was always clean - but please note - no-one speaks English!

Breakfast was an interesting affair, with salad, eggs, cold meats and whatever was left over from dinner - but it was edible.

We held a 2 day conference in the hotel and the room was up to standard, with projector and facilities you would expect in any business hotel.

The best thing about the hotel though is the bar outside - the best beer in town and cheap too!

title: Fantastic wedding venue!
text:
We were married here in March and I cannot rate the staff and the hotel enough - it was amazing! Everyone commented on the excellent food, the organisation of the day and the whole day went perfectly. Mae and the team are brilliant - they keep the day flowing and were so helpful when it came to the little details of the wedding.

If you're looking for a wedding venue - don't look any further - this is it!

The rooms are beautiful, beds very comfy and the food is second to none (the portion sizes are huge!).

We can't wait to come back for a visit.

title: Gorgeous hotel, brilliant food
text:
We stayed here in March for our honeymoon and were so pleased with the whole resort - its beautiful, the staff are great and the food amazing!

We normally eat at the buffet for breakfast then one of the al-a-carte restaurants in the evening (Creole restaurant was amazing!). The only restaurant that I wouldn't go back to was the Indian, it wasn't bad but it just wasn't up to the standard of the others.

Pools are lovely, loads of sunbeds, however the adult pool does get busy early on.

Room was brilliant! Huge bed, always clean and the maid made special effort with the decoration in the room every day. Shower is the best ever!

Only downside is that the wi-fi in the rooms is too expensive - I wouldn't pay the money for it.

I would recommend the hotel to anyone!
place: Grand Palladium Lady Hamilton Resort & Spa

title: Good airport hotel
text:
Stayed here 1 night before flying out of Gatwick - its a decent hotel. Rooms were spacious, bed comfy and bathroom good quality.

We ordered food from Room Service and it came quickly and was good quality.

title: Excellent day out
text: We spent a Saturday here in April and was pleasantly surprised! We had small children (1 in push chair) and they all enjoyed it too. It wasn't the most sunniest of days, however it didn't take anything away from the day. Some fantastic places to eat there and the quality of food was great. Going down the mine was an experience and was really glad we waited to do it.

title: Lovely staff, great hotel, comfy bed
text:
We stayed in this hotel in between the Christmas & New Year period and was pleasantly surprised. The beds are comfy (much better than Travelodge), the staff are really lovely - they always make the effort to say hello.

I would recommend the hotel to anyone staying in the area.
